docs.summary:
The `mediaManager` module contains functionality for working with
 the media that is stored in your site's [Media Manager](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-the-media-manager-568956).
description: To use the Media Manager API, import `mediaManager` from the `wix-media-backend` module:

params.name: fileName
params.doc:
Internal name (unique identifier) which is generated when a file is uploaded by the Media Manager, returned from the [`importFile()`](#importFile), or [`upload()`](#upload) functions. The name is the string located in the file's URL. Click [here](https://www.wix.com/velo/forum/tips-tutorials-examples/creating-a-url-for-a-media-file-or-the-truth-about-getfileurl) to learn more. This name is used when calling the [`getFileInfo()`](#getFileInfo), [`getFileUrl()`](#getFileUrl),
 and [`getVideoPlaybackUrl()`](#getVideoPlaybackUrl) functions.

docs.summary: Gets a file's information from the Media Manager by `fileName`.
description: The `getFileInfo()` function returns a Promise that resolves to information about

The `fileName` property is the internal name (unique identifier) which is generated when a file is uploaded by the Media Manager, returned from the [`importFile()`](#importFile), or [`upload()`](#upload) functions.
To get the `fileName`, select your media file in the Media Manager and copy the URL in the 'File Info' dropdown on the right sidebar. The name is the string located in the file's URL.
You can see how to get the following `fileName` strings for each media type:

Internal name (unique identifier) which is generated when a file is uploaded by the Media Manager, returned from the [`importFile()`](#importFile), or [`upload()`](#upload) functions. The name is the string located in the file's URL. Click [here](https://www.wix.com/velo/forum/tips-tutorials-examples/creating-a-url-for-a-media-file-or-the-truth-about-getfileurl) to learn more. This name is used when calling the [`getFileInfo()`](#getFileInfo), [`getFileUrl()`](#getFileUrl),
 and [`getVideoPlaybackUrl()`](#getVideoPlaybackUrl) functions.

docs.summary: Gets a temporary download URL with a token from the Media Manager for a specified file.
description: The `getFileUrl()` function returns a Promise that resolves to
a download URL with a token for the specified file.
Pass a Media Manager file name (unique identifier) in the `fileName` parameter
as returned in the `fileName` property from the [`getFileInfo()`](#getFileInfo),
> Alternatively, you can create a static URL where `filename` is the Media Manager file name (unique identifier):

description: The `getFolderInfo()` function returns a Promise that resolves to information about
The `folderId` property is the internal name (unique identifier) which is generated when a folder is created by the Media Manager.

params.name: path
params.doc:
The path within the Media Manager where the file will be
 uploaded. If the path does not yet exist, the missing folders will be created.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options to use when uploading the file.

docs.summary: Gets an upload URL with a token.
description: The `getUploadUrl()` function returns a Promise that resolves to an object
containing an upload URL with a token.
Use `getUploadUrl()` to allow an external client to upload a single file to your
The URL with the token is valid for a single file upload only. `getUploadUrl` must be called for each file that you want to upload.
The external client uploads a file by performing a POST operation to the
URL returned by `getUploadUrl()` using multipart/form-data encoding and
+ `value`: The file content as a multi-part value.
+ `filename`: The name of the file as it will appear in the Media Manager.
+ `contentType`: The content type of the file.
The POST will return the following:
"labels": [] <image recognition labels of the image content>,
To get a Wix image URL that can be stored in a collection or displayed in an image
element or gallery from the above object, use the following expression:

examples.title: Get a URL with a token to be used for uploading a file by POST

const response = await request.post({url: uploadUrl, formData: body, json: true});

extra.description:
This example demonstrates how to create a URL that an external application can 
 use to upload a file to your site's Media Manager. 

 The **Wix backend** code demonstrates how to create the URL and the **External Node.js**
 code demonstrates how to use the URL to upload an image and then create a Wix image URL
 from the upload response.

params.name: fileName
params.doc:
Internal name (unique identifier) which is generated when a file is uploaded by the Media Manager, returned from the [`importFile()`](#importFile), or [`upload()`](#upload) functions. The name is the string located in the file's URL. Click [here](https://www.wix.com/velo/forum/tips-tutorials-examples/creating-a-url-for-a-media-file-or-the-truth-about-getfileurl) to learn more. This name is used when calling the [`getFileInfo()`](#getFileInfo), [`getFileUrl()`](#getFileUrl),
 and [`getVideoPlaybackUrl()`](#getVideoPlaybackUrl) functions.

params.name: format
params.doc: The format of the URL to get. Either `"hls"` or `"dash"`.

docs.summary: Imports a file to the Media Manager from a URL.
description: The `importFile()` function returns a Promise that resolves to information
Video and audio files that have been imported are not immediately available
to be used even after the Promise is resolved. Before they can be used, they
event is fired when a file has been uploaded and before the transcoding is finished.

Pass one of the following in the `folderId` parameter:
+ Will return a list of files in the Root folder.
+ As returned in the `folderId` or `parentFolderId` property from the
functions. Make sure to pass the folderId as a string.

docs.summary: Uploads a file to the Media Manager from a [buffer](https://nodejs.org/api/buffer.html#buffer_static_method_buffer_from_string_encoding).
description: The `upload()` function returns a Promise that resolves to information about
When the file is uploaded the [`onFileUploaded()`](wix-media-backend.Events.html#onFileUploaded)
Video and audio files that have been uploaded are not immediately available
to be used even after the Promise is resolved. Before they can be used, they
event is fired when a file has been uploaded and before the transcoding is finished.

>**Note:** There are limits on the size and duration of files that you can upload. See [Wix Media: Supported Media File Types and File Sizes](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-media-supported-media-file-types-and-file-sizes) for more details.

extra.description:
This example demonstrates how to upload a file using a custom upload button.
 It assumes you have a regular button on your page wired to an event handler.

 It also assumes that you have
 [installed](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-code-how-to-manage-external-code-libraries-with-the-package-manager#installing-a-new-package) the
 **request-promise** node module to your site. The example uses **request-promise**
 to create a Buffer containing the contents of the file to upload.

members.name: fileName
members.doc:
The `fileName` property is the internal name (unique identifier) which is generated when a file is uploaded by the Media Manager, returned from the [`importFile()`](#importFile), or [`upload()`](#upload) functions. The name is the string located in the file's URL. Click [here](https://www.wix.com/velo/forum/tips-tutorials-examples/creating-a-url-for-a-media-file-or-the-truth-about-getfileurl) to learn more. This name is used when calling the [`getFileInfo()`](#getFileInfo), [`getFileUrl()`](#getFileUrl),
and [`getVideoPlaybackUrl()`](#getVideoPlaybackUrl) functions.

members.name: fileUrl
members.doc: URL of the file.

members.name: hash
members.doc: File hash.

members.name: sizeInBytes
members.doc: Size of the uploaded file in bytes.

members.name: mimeType
members.doc:
[Mime type](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types) of
 the uploaded file.

members.name: mediaType
members.doc:
Type of the file that was uploaded.
 One of:

 + `"audio"`
 + `"document"`
 + `"image"`
 + `"shape"`
 + `"video"`

members.name: isPrivate
members.doc:
Whether the link to the uploaded file is
 public or private. Private links require a token to be used.

members.name: parentFolderId
members.doc: ID of the uploaded files parent folder.

members.name: originalFileName
members.doc:
Original name of the uploaded file. This is the display name
 that appears in the Media Manager.

members.name: opStatus
members.doc:
Status of the file that was uploaded.
 One of:

 + `"IN-DOWNLOAD-QUEUE"`
 + `"IN-QUEUE"`
 + `"READY"`

members.name: sourceURL
members.doc: URL where the file was uploaded from.

members.name: iconUrl
members.doc: URL of the file's icon.

members.name: labels
members.doc: List of labels assigned to the file by the Media Manager.

members.name: height
members.doc: File height.

members.name: width
members.doc: File width.

docs.summary: An object including folderId, mediaType, and isPrivate for filtering files.

members.name: string
members.doc: The parent folderId

members.name: string
members.doc: Media type (image, video, shape, document, music, etc..) - leave blank for All

members.name: boolean
members.doc: Private / public files (leave blank for both public and private)

members.name: string
members.doc: The parent folderId

Type of the file to upload.
 One of:

 + `"audio"`

members.name: mimeType
members.doc:
[Mime type](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types) of
 the file to import. The specified value must match the actual mime type of
 the file's content.

value: contentStream, // a Node.js Buffer with the file content

members.name: isPrivate
members.doc:
Whether the link to the uploaded file will
 be public or private. Private links require a token to be used. Defaults to
 `false`.

members.name: isVisitorUpload
members.doc:
Indicates if the file was uploaded by a
 site visitor. Files uploaded by visitors are tagged in the Media Manager as
 being added by a visitor. Defaults to `true`.

members.name: context
members.doc:
An object of key:value string pairs that is sent
 back in the [`onFileUploaded()`](wix-media-backend.Events.html#onFileUploaded)
 event.

members.name: fileName
members.doc: In this case the fileName is the name you would like your file to appear as in the Media Manager.

docs.summary: An object including limit and offset for pagination options

members.name: limit
members.doc: The amount of records to retrieve

members.name: offset
members.doc: The number of records to skip

docs.summary: An object including sortBy and sortDirection for sorting options

members.name: sortBy
members.doc: Field to sort by: 'name' or 'date'

members.name: sortDirection
members.doc: The direction of sorting: 'asc' or 'desc'

members.name: uploadUrl
members.doc: The URL to POST a file to.

members.name: uploadToken
members.doc: The token to use with the file POST.

members.name: folderId
members.doc: The id of the folder. This id is used when calling the [`listFiles()`](#listFiles), and [`listFolders()`](#listFolders) functions.

members.name: folderName
members.doc: Name of the folder.

members.name: parentFolderId
members.doc: The id of the parent folder. This id can be used when calling the [`listFiles()`](#listFiles), and [`listFolders()`](#listFolders) functions.

members.name: tags
members.doc:
An array of tags.
